unittitle_ssm: Fragments of the deed from Indians to Lion Gardiner
abstract_ssm: Lion Gardiner (1599-1663) was an English colonist who founded the first English settlement on Long Island, New York. In 1639 he purchased an island from the Montaukett tribe on the eastern end of Long Island (today known as Gardiners Island). The collection contains fragments of what is believed to be a deed from the Indians to Lion Gardiner, circa 1639-1663. Presumably the deed is for Gardiners Island or other nearby property.
corpname_ssm: Brooklyn Historical Society (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)
